title: Path of Exile
notes: No DX11 support in Steam's config, will crash on first run, then ask to relaunch as DX9. Game plays well. Will eventually crash due to suspected memory leak during an area change. Most susceptible to this crash after around an hour of normal play.

title: Path of Exile
notes: Some drops of performances, but probably because the GPU is quite weak. Works only in DirectX 9

title: Path of Exile
notes: No DX11 support in Steam's config, will crash on first run, then ask to relaunch as DX9.  PoE is otherwise known to run w/DX11, so how do we enable that in Steam?

title: Path of Exile
notes: Works in dx9 mode. Good performance (average about 60fps, highest ~90s and some spikes) on lowest settings. Occasional lag/fps spikes when exploding packs and such, but that's normal for PoE (may also be because of my internet). Levelling experience should be perfectly smooth, but I'd stay away from higher level maps and such unless you have better hardware than me lol

title: Path of Exile
notes: Occasional lag spikes / fps drops

title: Path of Exile
notes: First time running gives a ton of errors regarding missing fonts. Subsequent runs use DX9. Everything seems to run correctly but at an unplayable performance level

title: Path of Exile
notes: Runs with all effects but video card is old.

title: Path of Exile
notes: game doesn't start, it doesn't ask me to switch to dx9 unlike what others said

title: Path of Exile
notes: Won't launch.  Just instantly crashes out with nothing displayed.  Tried several drivers.

title: Path of Exile
notes: Game appears to work fine on first glance, but there is an issue that causes a sub 1 second delay with no FPS updates. Seems to be when its trying to handle a new pack of mobs appearing - note its not when the mobs are near the player, just when they are in range to appear so they aren't even graphically displayed yet. Could be the engine already is preparing to render them. Same machine has 0 issues on Windows with PoE. Note this machine gets 55-60 FPS with this in Linux, but these freezes make it unplayable/painful.

title: Path of Exile
notes: Game won't start in standard mode, but tells you to switch to dx9 mode. Runs in dx9 mode and for what I've tested no problems. Some frame drops evey now and then on some spells and may crash on level change

notes: Crashes on first launch (DX11), works in DX9 mode

notes: Game runs, performance is choppy to the point of unplayable when loading things in, random crashes.

title: Path of Exile
notes: With a gtx 760, its playable not "Windows" like but playable. Setting stuff to low, fullscreen, vsync off helps. I get stutter and fps drops every-time i enter a map, use skills/magic for the 1st time, may be do to caching something? It only happens once per game launch. Launch options used, PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1

title: Path of Exile
notes:
Doesn't start under DirectX 11: Pop-up shows "Failed to create WIC Factory" (+ other errors related to missing fonts).

Runs OK under DirectX 9 with occasional FPS drops and inferior performance compared to native gameplay.
protonVersion: Tested under both 3.7-3 and 3.7-5 (). Same results.

title: Path of Exile
notes: The DX11 versions crashes with the message "Failed to create WIC Factory". The game will then prompt you to use DX9. This version works but has severe fps problems and pauses for 2-3 seconds frequently.

title: Path of Exile
notes: Graphic glitches at times/ playable/ frame rate between 40 & 120 fps/ errors out with dx11. Have to revert to dx9. Also have same results with the Radeon hd 5870 GPU. Have to turn shadows completly off. To have decent frame rate.

title: Path of Exile
notes: Error: Exception / Failed to create WIC Factory

title: Path of Exile
notes: Runs on DX9, fails on fonts for DX11. Performance is too bad to play, stutters.

title: Path of Exile
notes: It appears that the new league update from 2018-08-31 (PoE 3.4 Delve) has added calls that are not supported by the DX9 implementation. I can start the game but after a few minutes of playing the game crashes with an error referencing a DX call that isn't found.

title: Path of Exile
notes: directx11 version crashes, directx9ex version works without issues

title: Path of Exile
notes: Runs ok, but sometimes after some hours of gameplay pops up errors related to memory allocation.

title: Path Of Exile
notes: Performance is bad, a lot of stutter. Only works with dx9

Will crash on initial start with DX11 and ask you to run in DX9, will work afterwards with no other setup. Game is (very) sluggish for a few minutes then becomes OK. This also happens when moving from one place to another. Can crash seemingly randomly after hours of play.
title: Path of Exile

notes:
Game performance now comparable to Dx9 version of Windows - except one show stopper. The game crashes after time due to a memory failure, that appears to be graphics card memory. Is likely a Dx9 compatibility issue. Dx11 version still crashes on start.
Until the crash is fixed the game can't really be played beyond the first act.
title: Path of Exile

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 470 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Crashes on DX11 mode, works only in DX9. The game was very stuttery at first, apparently due to shaders being compiled, especially in the starting town as people with various particle-effect-laden gear were coming in and out.  I crashed four times during 45 minutes of play, twice due to some .dds file being unable to load and other two due to a "cannot create thread" error. The MTX shop's front page also has some black boxes that I assume should have some sort of adverts in them.

title: Path of Exile

notes: The game "works" using dx9 despite the bad optimization it already has on its own (30fps or less and frame drops in low settings using a gtx  1060 '-'), but crashes are way to common during map load due to dx fails or a ton of "fail to uncompress x", making leveling a hell and sometimes impossible (sometimes I just gave up and open poe on windows to pass a map)

title: Path of Exile

notes: Tested on dx9, won't launch with dx11. Plays fine except stutters when caching new textures. This happens often, which makes it ALMOST unplayable.
title: Path of Exile

notes:
DX9 mode after DX11 fails. Stutters when loading new spells/textures.  Towns are the worst with people arriving and leaving constantly.
Adding --waitforpreload and --noasync  to launch options improves later stuttering on loading textures (but it still happens).
title: Path of Exile

notes: Finished the tutorial and then after third dungeon i got a crash with a popup windows exception: unable to create rtt backing texture.
title: Path of Exile

notes: If it runs only in Directx9 stop rating it above Bronze after ACT 4 onwards the game will crash every 5 Portals and the Game becomes unplayable. ATM it will not run in Directx11!
title: Path of Exile

notes:
Tried adding "--waitforpreload --nodx9ex --nologo --gc 2" to the launch options. Game loaded fine (DX9 mode onyl) and was able to play without stuttering. However I attempted to go into a new area thats part of the new expansion and it failed to load.

I would say that if you're unable to get into all areas of the game, it's crucially unplayable therefore i'm rating it as Borked.

notes: Tried various tweaks, still has awful stuttering rendering game unplayable. DX11 doesn't work at all.
